item.answer:
【考法 1】 n. 粗野的人; a rude, boorish person
【例】 He must have had some ups and downs in life to make him such a churl.
【近】crude, coarse, boorish, loutish, uncultured, unpolishe,boor, lout
【反】genteel, complaisance, courtly, polished 文雅的，彬彬有礼的；sophisticated 机智圆滑的
【派】churlish adj. 粗野的，暴躁的：of, like, or befitting a churl; boorish or vulgar
【考法 2】 n. 吝啬的人：a mean grasping person who is usually stingy with money
【例】Don't bother asking a churl for donations. 别自找麻烦向一个吝啬鬼要捐款。
【近】miser, niggard, skinflint, penny-pincher
【反】generous/ liberal/ munificent person 慷慨的人；waster, wastrel, spendthrift, prodigal, profligate, dissipater 败家子
